title: The Spag [released version]
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Ethnic groups
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Italians - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Racism - Australia
abstract: Giovannino (a.k.a.Tony), a newspaper boy, struggles to make ends meet for his widowed mother while avoiding the cruel racist taunts of the local thugs.
description: Director Giorgio Mangiamele produced the first examples of multicultural cinema in this country. 'The Spag' was shot in the streets of Carlton and tells the story of a newspaper boy working to support his widowed mother; along the way his life is fraught with racism. The film is Neo-Realist in style and makes interesting use of incidental music and post-sync dubbed dialogue track; a dog's bark is even mimicked by an actor's voice. Stars the young Terry Donovan.
